Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Arasin-likeSp (UCSS1a, 2S=S, natural AMPs; Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: most common mud crabs in Asia,Scylla paramamosain

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram-positive A. viridans, M. Luteus, (MIC 0.2-0.78 ug/ml) and Gram-negative V. harveyi and V. anguillarum. Bactericidal effects were verified. Provided by Biswajit Mishra.
Literature Information.Author: Imjongjirak C, Amparyup P, Tassanakajon A.2011
Literature Information.Title: Two novel antimicrobial peptides, arasin-likeSp and GRPSp, from the mud crab Scylla paramamosain, exhibit the activity against some crustacean pathogenic bacteria.
